title: Eric Williams, Copy Editor at WebMD

sections.heading: Overview
content: Eric Williams is a copy editor for WebMD.

He’s been editing for a while. While studying at the University of Arkansas at Little Rock, he was a part-time proofreader for the Arkansas Code Revision Commission, helping a staff of lawyers and other proofreaders revamp Arkansas statutory laws. After earning his bachelor’s in broadcast journalism, he copy edited at the Arkansas Gazette, Fort Lauderdale Sun-Sentinel, Dallas Morning News, and CNN Digital.

Along the way, he took a break from journalism to help teach English to junior high school kids in Mimasaka, Japan, as part of the Japan Exchange and Teaching Program; he won awards from the Sun-Sentinel and the National Association for Black Journalists for headline writing; and he started a persistent running habit.

His newsroom editing has covered a variety of topics, from international and national news, to state and local stories, to science and health reports. At the Morning News, he also copy edited and laid out stories for the Discoveries science section.
At WebMD, Williams specializes in health topics, mostly publishing news reports, features, and stories that readers use as medical references.
When he’s not working, you might see him running. This year will mark his 17th Peachtree Road Race.
